entry.title: Retention Process in SAP Purchase Orders: A Practical Guide
entry.content:
What is the Retention Process?

The retention Process in SAP MM is used to withhold a portion of the vendor payment when procuring services or long-term project-based deliverables, ensuring that vendors fulfil all contractual obligations (e.g., performance, warranty, defect rectification).

This is especially common in:

  1. Construction projects
  2. maintenance contracts
  3. Civil Engineering works
  4. Large-scale service procurement

Why Retention is needed

PurposeBenefit
Contract ComplianceEnsures vendors meet quality and performance terms
Risk ControlProtects the buyer from incomplete or defective service
Defect LiabilityRetention acts as a buffer to correct future issues
Financial ControlAvoids overpayment before service validation
Negotiation LeverageEncourages timely and accurate delivery by the vendor

üèóBusiness Scenario: Civil work contract with 20% Retention

ABC Ltd. hires a vendor for building renovation work worth 500 SAR. According to the contract, a 20% retention is to be withheld and paid 2 months after completion, provided no defects arise.

Step-by-Step Configuration

Step 1: Define Document Types (Transaction: OMR4/OBA7)

Path: SPRO > Financial Accounting > Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable > Business Transactions > Incoming Invoices/Credit Memos > Make and Check Document Settings > Define Document Types

Go to change mode and click on Number Ranges to create the number ranges

Step 2: Assign Document Type to Invoice (Transaction: OMR4)

Step 3: Create Balance Sheet General Ledger Account (Transaction: FS00)

Mention the short text and the G/L account long text

Maintain tax category as *

Check the field status group (G067 - reconciliation accounts)

Step 4: Define Control Parameters

Path: SPRO > Materials Management > Logistics Invoice Verification > Incoming Invoice > Retention > Define Default Due Date for Retention > Define Control Parameters for Retention

Step 5: Maintain Accounting Configuration (Transaction: FBKP)

Expand the Special GL tree and find account type K and special GL indicator R (retention). If no entry exists, click on create and maintain the special GL indicator fr account type K (Refer to step  4 for special GL indicator creation/assignment)

Map the reconciliation accounts to the Balance Sheet G/L that we created in step 3

Step 6: Assign Reconiliation Account in Business Partner (Transaction: BP)

Assign the reconciliation account under the company code data

Step 7: Create Purchase Order  (Transaction: ME21N-Advanced)

Mention Supplier, Retention at the Header level and enter the percentage

(Note: Retention can also be mentioned at the item level, you can opt for an option according to your business requirements.)

PO Total value: 500 SAR

Retention Percentage: 20%

Step 7: Post Goods Receipt for Purchase Order (Transaction: MIGO)

Once posted, check the FI documents

Step 8: Post Incoming Invoice (Transaction: MIRO)

Total amount: 500 SAR, input tax: 25 SAR, Total amount with tax: 525 SAR

Retention value: 20% of 525 is 105 SAR

Once posted, display the invoice document

2 accounting documents generated;

1 for retention document, 1 for invoice GR/IR clearing document

Accounting Document 0000500000

Special GL indicator R reflected (refer to step 4 for special GL creation)

Accounting document 5100000039

Step 9: Post Outgoing Payment (Transaction: F-53)

Enter the Document date, the Bank account, the actual amount to pay to the vendor (or enter a random amount), and the vendor number under the Open Item selection.

Note: Now you're paying the vendor 420 SAR (excluding the retention). The system will clear the vendor's open item (420 SAR) and record the bank payment.

First, select all options and click deactivate items

Second, select the retention amount and the total amount line item and click on activate. Once activated, you can see the amount of details in the processing status section.

(Note: Amount displayed here is the actual amount you need to pay to the vendor, excluding the  retention amount)

Once posted, display the document

AccountDebit/CreditAmountDescription
vendor (300303)Debit420 SARClear vendor liability
Bank Account (113103)Credit420 SAROutgoing Bank payment

Step 10: Report to Check pending dues (Transaction: FBL1N)

In the initial screen, mention the vendor code, the company code, and check special GL transactions, then execute

Retention Payable Ledger (Special GL):

Credit Balance: 105 SAR (still outstanding, to be released later)

(Please refer to step 3 for creating a balance sheet GL account)

If you found this guide helpful, don‚Äôt miss my other SAP MM WM blogs covering real-world automation, configuration tips, and best practices for procurement, inventory management, and warehouse management.

Click to view other SAP MM WM Blogs - SAP Community

 

Regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: Re: Rebate and Royalties in SAP S/4
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1, 

You will have a high risk that your subtotal in your billing doc will not be correct if: 

  • You're using a scale for rebate
  • Contract for rebate is not created/released in time 
  • Contract for rebates is not correctly maintained (e.g. miss a material or added a material that shouldn't be considered, same for any other criteria)
  • Rate in Rebate contract is not maintained correctly

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: WPDTC tcode calculation of PDT and deviation calculated?

Hello Experts,

I am trying to understand how WPDTC tcode works however the available information is not sufficient. Can you please help in understanding how the Calculated PDT is coming in the field and Proportion of GR qty to PO qty field is calculating. I have attached a screenshot with reference which I am looking to understand the calculations.

In my screenshot, the PIR 1st row is showing Proportion of GR qty to PO qty field (highlighted in yellow) as 2. How it got calculated? How is the deviation getting calculated? Is it w.r.t the PO PDT - Proportion field?

And calculated PDT field in Blue suggests the new PDT so where should I update it? In PO or EINA or anywhere else?

Can you answer my queries and let me know if anything is required from my end?

Looking forward for your response. Thanks in advance.

How can we ensure that when MRP run, it doesn't create a planned order if the BOM is inactive?

entry.title: TIMEOUT dump (11 min.) for RFC in low priority (runtime unlimited) if started in dialog
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm testing the timeout (or not timeout) in RFC tasks in Low priority (classic aRFC started by the method RUN_INST of CL_ABAP_PARALLEL, which I call from a custom program), and I'm surprised that a timeout happens after 11 minutes (short dump TIMEOUT) although the low priority has no timeout defined (so, unlimited runtime).

The TIMEOUT dump happens if the custom program is started in dialog, but it doesn't happen if it's started in background. In both cases, the priority is shown as Low in SM50.

The profile parameter rdisp/scheduler/prio_low/max_runtime has no value, so it should not do a timeout as the documentation says (it's also what the SAP notes say):

"If no value is specified, the runtime is unlimited."

11 minutes corresponds to the high priority set in the profile parameter rdisp/scheduler/prio_high/max_runtime.

The short dump TIMEOUT contains the message:

"The maximum runtime of a program is set by profile parameter "rdisp/scheduler/prio_low/max_runtime". The current setting is 660 seconds. If the current setting deviates from the value of the parameter in question, the application has set the maximum runtime itself. Once the maximum runtime is exceeded, the program is aborted."

For information, the profile parameter rdisp/max_wprun_time does not exist (it was deprecated by SAP a long time ago), so it means that the parameters rdisp/scheduler/prio_*/max_runtime are used.

The RFC starts this way (code started by running the method RUN_INST of CL_ABAP_PARALLEL) i.e., it's "aRFC with wait", so the application doesn't change the priority (anyway, I see Low in SM50, it must be the one used, even if it's changed):

      call function 'RS_ABAP_PARALLEL_INST'
        starting new task L_TASK-NAME
        destination L_SERVER_NAME
        calling END_TASK_INST on end of task
        exporting
          P_IN                  = <L_IN>
          P_TIME_OUT            = TIME_OUT
        exceptions
          COMMUNICATION_FAILURE = 1 message L_MESSAGE
          SYSTEM_FAILURE        = 1 message L_MESSAGE.

I can understand why RFC behaves like this. It makes sense.

Do you know any link to an official SAP documentation which clearly explains these behaviors?

Thanks.

Sandra

Environment: ABAP 7.58

entry.title: Who can delete draft cases? and How?
entry.content:
i am not able to delete system XXX, since i have to clear the draft cases.

Since i have no rights, to do any changes to those draft cases, i cant do anything.

Can you give me the name of who has the rights to delete those draft cases? and the steps of How?

Thank you.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Who can delete draft cases? and How?
entry.content:
Dear customer,

The following S-users can delete Draft cases which have a status of Not Sent to SAP:

  • S-user ID that created the draft case
  • Super Administrators listed in My Important Contacts

Only Super Administrators can delete draft cases for other S-users; Cloud and User Administrators cannot delete draft cases created by other S-users at this time.

Steps to delete a draft case

  1. Go to SAP for Me > Draft Cases
  2. Select the draft case you wish to delete from the list (has a status of Not Sent to SAP)
  3. Click ‚ÄúDelete‚Äù on the upper right
  4. On the Close pop up, click ‚ÄùDelete‚Äú

Also refer to KBA 2594949 - How to delete a draft case - SAP for Me.

And hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: WPDTC tcode calculation of PDT and deviation calculated?
entry.content:
WPDTC analyses historical purchasing documents (POs and their GRs) to calculate an average planned delivery time for a material/vendor combination. It uses the difference between PO creation date and goods receipt date for each document, optionally weighted by the quantity received. The results are shown per purchasing info record (PIR) or other aggregation level, and you can then decide whether to update the Planned Delivery Time in the master data.

The weighting factor used in the average calculation formular would be "Proportion = (Goods Receipt Quantity) √∑ (Purchase Order Quantity)". If you received double the PO quantity like PO was for 100, GR was for 200, the proportion will be 2.0. If you received exactly what you ordered, it will be 1.0. If you received half, it will be 0.5. SAP uses this proportion to weight the delivery time in the average ‚Äî so large deliveries influence the average more than small ones.

Also, WPDTC does not automatically change master data; it only proposes the new value. You can update it in the Purchasing Info Record (EINA/EINE) ‚Üí field Planned Delivery Time. Or, if you don‚Äôt use PIRs, in the Material Master (Purchasing view) ‚Üí field Planned Delivery Time.

entry.title: Lot sizing procedure "EX" reaction with sales order in same day
entry.content:
Hi,

we use lot sizing procedure "EX" = Lot-for-lot order quantity for many products

When we have one sale order per day, the system works as expected and creates one planned order per day.

But when we have two sales orders on the same day, the system regroups the requirements into a single planned order.
We expected the system to create two planned orders.

Do you know why, and is there anything we can do to improve our situation and ensure that MRP creates two planned orders if we have two orders on the same day?

 

thank you

entry.title: Re: Reassigning Scope & Solution Process in Test Preparation is now available
entry.content:
Hi Christina,

 thanks for this improvement, that makes our life easier when something goes wrong or when we need to create test cases in mass. At least now we are able to edit the test cases that were not assigned to any solution process and add this important information. It keeps the governance and traceability of the tests. 

It's great to see how SAP is considering the influence requests and improving the products based on our experience and pain.

I still miss the possibility to do this assignment in mass upload, as this would save a lot of time when the number of test cases is huge. Looking forward to having the IDs available to download, which is mandatory to make a complete mass upload. Hope we can get it any day soon from the Process Management team. üòâ

Kind regards,

Raquel

entry.title: üü† Status-Transition Flows
entry.content:
The feature adds an option to define Flows (statuses and transitions between statuses) directly in the CDS model using annotations. The required handlers are automatically generated and registered based on the declaratively defined annotations. The generated logic can still be overwritten by the application developers, which gives maximum freedom in complex scenarios.

SPEAKER: Simon Engel

entry.title: Re: Role Collection Assignment in Build Work Zone, Standa...
entry.content:
Hi Julius,

I found the solution for this.

We can not create the group in BTP Sub Account level but we can create the groups in SAP Cloud Identity Service and assign the user to the group in SAP CIS.

Now in Subaccount level we can map this group to role collection and the user associated with that group will get the roles.

The Group name will not auto populate in the BTP, we need to copy the group name from CIS to the Role collection mapping.

 

I am marking this as solved.


Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Enable DIR documents from referenco objects in maintance order Fiori applications
entry.content:
Greetings,

we are wondering if it possible ti display DIR documents in maintenance order Fiori applications. These documents are assigned:

  • at equipment level
  • at functional location level

Fiori applications in question:

  • manage maintenance notifications and orders
  • find maintence orders

We are aware of possibility to display the documents in "Process maintenance order" app and the functionality described in note 3392917. Unfortunately this is only applicable in limited set of scenarios and does not solve our initial problem,

This functionality is available in standard in GUI transactions and it provides a nice shortcut to documents related to maintenance of technical objects. This is relevant for proactive and reactive maintenance.

Best regards, M,

entry.title: Re: SAP Workzone Content Provider from another subaccount...
entry.content:
HI @Cristian ,  we have solved the issue by replacing the desing time dest URL from https://<SAP BTP provider subaccount domain>.<type>.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com (URL was copied from provider LP URL) to https://<SAP BTP provider subaccount domain>.<type>.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com. 

After doing this in both consumer and provider subaccount the content channel refresh works. It seems only the generic regional URL is working in this scenario.

Best regards,

Markus

However, not fully clear for me. Do you mean to create a new DC like let's say: D0 - Common DC, and add it as a common one (in VOR1)? e.g.:

SOrg.| DChn | Ref.DCh-Cust/Mt
US01 | D0 | D0
US01 | D1 | D0

(D0 - Common DC, D1 - Wholesale, D2 - Retail, ...)

entry.title: Re: Role Collection Assignment in Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hello Rohit, Yes correct. In addition, you can do one of 2 things depending on whether your idp is azure or IAS. If you have groups defined in your azure idp (or in your corporate IDP), you can map the roles to Azure groups in the sub-account. In that case, the users will see apps based on their Azure groups. Second option is similar to what you were saying in IAS. But instead of manually creating, you could propagate the groups from Azure Active directory to your IAS and from IAS to BTP. The groups will not appear in the sub account but the users will have access to the apps. Just like magic üôÇ Glad you figured this out by going the IAS route. 

The second advantage of this route (azure or IAS) is that when user are no longer with the company and are terminated in the IDP, they automatically lose access to build work zone. So no additional work is needed during terminations.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Foundry - Python and Cloud Connector - TCP
entry.content:
Hello! Thank  you for this awesome blog.

I'm implementing a very similar app. However, my TCP connection sometimes takes up to 20s to establish the socket

this part

cc_socket.connect(
dest_host=cloud_connector,
dest_port=application_port,
proxy_host=proxy_host,
proxy_port=proxy_port,
token=token,
location_id=location_id
)

Usually takes 0.25 seconds but around 1/12 times it spikes up to 10 to 20 seconds. Have you experienced something similar? 

The idea of the app is to serve as a REST endpoint to be consumed by Integration Suite where the app connects to different Cloud Connectors to obtain certian information from devices in our internal network.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Integration: How to use Password Credentials for Outbound Request
entry.content:
Hi Ankur,

This thread is old, but maybe someone will encounter the same error: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Access Token was not found in the response

The reason is that the Access Token is not being returned to be used for accessing REST API Destinations. This is most likely the result of not providing the correct Token URL in Security Material - Client Credentials. Info about this was missing in Carlos article and first I put there wrong URL... The correct URL is the URI taken from the service key + /oauth/token path, so the full URL would be something like this:

https://<subdomain>.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

entry.title: BI 4.3 Report / Universe Metadata missing for unchanged migrated reports
entry.content:
Hi there

A customer of mine needs to change Web Intelligence Report queries in their BI 4.3 system from an old set of universes to a new set, which I intend to do using the Workflow Manager. To assist with this, we are trying to establish all of the reports that use those old universes.

These methods can be used to establish the universe/report relationships without actually opening and looking at the reports themselves:

1) Right-click on a universe, choose Tools > Check Relationships

That gives you a list of files that relate to that universe, including folders, connection objects and reports.

2) Open the properties of a report and Choose "Default Settings" > "Report Universes". That gives a list of universes used in that report.

3) Use the CMS Universe that is now provided with the system, which looks at the same data.

However... what I'm finding, and I've found with other systems, is that the above works for all reports that have been created or amended on that system. For those reports which haven't been amended since being migrated to the system from a different system (typically older system), this metadata is missing. So reports might be scheduled or opened and refreshed, but if the report isn't saved back, then that data is missing.

For example - a report which was migrated to the current BI 4.3 system, from the previous BI 4.2 system the customer used (using Promotion Management Wizard) shows the following when its properties are opened in the CMC:

If I then open the report in Design mode, make a trivial change (such as adding a space to the Description object in the properties) and then saving the report back to the Input File Repository, it then updates the meta data.

Opening the report's properties in the CMC and amending the properties there doesn't do this, it actually requires the file itself to be changed.

Now this customer has many thousands of reports in public and personal folders. I don't want to have to open every single file to work out which reports use the universes in question, I would like to be able to use the report I've built which uses the CMS universe. That CMS report works for all those reports which have been created and changed since their content was migrated there, but the unchanged reports are missing.

Does anyone have any ideas of methods that could be used to force the system's meta-data to be updated for all reports automatically? I wondered if there was something in the Workflow Assistant but I don't think there is (and that in itself is somewhat cumbersome to use albeit the best solution for tasks such as universe query repointing).

Thanks very much

entry.title: Re: TIMEOUT dump (11 min.) for RFC in low priority (runti...
entry.content:
Hi Sandra,

1. Using transaction RZ11, increase the profile parameter rdisp/max_wprun_time from 660 to the maximum. It should be a dynamic parameter that you can change the value of on the fly.

2. Since it is a custom program, enable the ST12 trace to check the performance trace and find the SQL trace summary.

Regards

SS

Is this a known/expected behavior? If yes, could you please help me with the reason behind this?

I read on some chatbot that SAP GUI Checkbox events are buffered until some other action is performed and sent then, but I couldn't find any document/post mentioning the same. 

Thanks.

entry.title: Re: TIMEOUT dump (11 min.) for RFC in low priority (runti...
entry.content:
Oh nice, I didn't even look at the P_TIMEOUT parameter. So, if I debug my case, CL_ABAP_PARALLEL takes the priority of the current session (high if it's running in dialog, low if it's running in background) and so it considers correctly the timeout. SM50 always shows "Low" but it doesn't mean the timeout, as said in the dump, the timeout may be set by the application which is the case here. By looking at inside the function module RS_ABAP_PARALLEL_INST, one can see the way an application can set the timeout (number of seconds):

data(L_RUNT_TIME) = CL_RUNTIME_FACTORY=>CREATE( ).
L_RUNT_TIME->SET_MAX_RUNTIME( P_TIME_OUT ).

entry.title: Re: C_S4CPB_2502 Dumps valid or Not?
entry.content:
Hello @brettskipp4311 

Using dumps is neither valid nor officially supported for preparing for SAP certifications. They often have outdated or incorrect information, and SAP‚Äôs exam policies ban their use. A better approach is to gain knowledge through authorised learning resources and practical experience.

Here is a recommended study path for C_S4CPB_2502 (SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Implementation with SAP Activate):

Understand the core concepts
 Explore the Learning Journey: Exploring Localisation as a Self-Service

Hands-on practice
Apply the knowledge in the Applying Localisation as a Self-Service course

Configuration and CBC focus
Enrol for Central Business Configuration (CBC) and localisation training, since CBC setup and country activation are key areas tested in this exam.

Deep dive into documentation & SAP Community
 Review SAP Help Portal: Localisation and Scope

Practice with sample questions
Use SAP‚Äôs official sample questions and reputable practice tests to familiarise yourself with the exam style (erpprep), but avoid dumps.

This approach guarantees you not only pass the exam but also acquire the knowledge to apply in real-world applications.

Happy to answer any further questions you might have.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT) - Climate Action : Corporate Carbon Footprint Calculation(CCF)
entry.content:
This blog outlines the steps involved in tracking and managing emissions from various business activities within different locations to get insights on environmental analysis using "Climate Action" application in SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT).

üåèThe earth speaks in colors, whispers in winds, and sings through rivers ‚Äî if only we choose to listen‚Ä¶üå±

What is Climate Action?

It is the heartbeat of Goal 13 in the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and one of the three main pillars of UNEP (United Nations Environment Programme). Climate Action is taking efforts to tackle climate change and reduce its impacts and adapt to the changes it causes.

SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) - Climate Action functionality  supports organizations to set up Corporate Carbon Footprint (CCF) feature to calculate their sustainability footprint. This feature facilitates the organizations to setup the data  for business activities (for example, Business Travel, Employee Commute) for each respective "Business Location" and calculate the carbon footprint using emission factors in the SAP SCT system.

Mini Note: This feature is distinct from "Data Collection Workflow for Quantitative Metrics". Both the functionalities are meant for collection of data via forms, but the apps, user roles and workflow are different from each other. To be able to use Climate Action - Corporate Carbon Footprint (CCF) calculations directly in SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT), we must run the "Booster" scenario from the SAP BTP cockpit.

Process Overview:

Overall Process Flow

Before we dive into the SAP Sustainability Control Tower-Climate Action process steps, and as part of the Climate Action awareness program, I would like to highlight a few key aspects of the Climate Action...

Did you know that tiny Sand Bubbler Crabs teach us about Climate Adaptation through their behavior?...

Very recently I had a chance to visit one of the coastal places surrounded by the Arabian Sea.  When I was strolling on the beach, a sand bubbler crab behavior caught my attention. I wondered why on earth such a tiny species would make a sand balls, then immediately I took my phone and sat down near its hole and started recording it...as soon as it noticed me, immediately it went into its hole and did not come back for a while...but I was waiting patiently without a movement...finally I captured the sand bubbler behavior. I was wondering why would it do so, and It taught me a big lesson...

Sand Bubbler Crab...

The Sand Bubbler Crabs are nature`s micro-recyclers and beach`s secret engineers. They make holes for their shelter and safety. When it comes to their feeding strategy, they pick up the sand and filter out the tiny chunks of organic matter and discard the sand in the form of tiny sand balls. Some crabs use sand balls as a barriers to confuse predators. This behavior help clean the coastal area and contribute to the health of beach ecosystems. These carbs adjust their activity based on temperature and tidal conditions. This is a survival strategy in extreme environmental conditions. This is what we should learn from Sand Bubbler Crabs for adaptability of Climate Change. The crab`s feeding process is a natural example of Circular Economy - Extract the organic matter from the sand and leave the sand in the form of balls and repeat the process each time when the tide returns. Their Presence or absence signals the shift in coastal climate patterns.

Though the act is very small, it is so vital. Climate action begins just like that...a mindful step. 

We have been witnessing the consequences of climate change...but, despite knowing the visible consequences, we continue to stall the efforts to combat climate change and adaptation measures...     Source: UNDP website

Climate Change is Increasing ocean and atmospheric temperatures, and due to which the sea levels are going up and as a result, the frequency of hurricanes, rainfall rates are increasing...

If you want to gain a deeper understanding of SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT), check out my blog links below for more insights...

  1. SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) - Generate ESG Reports With AI Application 
  2. Managing Qualitative Metrics in SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT) for ESRS and BRSR Framework 
  3. Exporting and Importing Custom Objects and CPE Packages in SAP Sustainability Control Tower 
  4. Achieving Sustainability With SAP Asset Performance Management By Leveraging Industrial Systems. 
  5. SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT) Metric Management-Basic Custom Metric & Standard Custom Metric 
  6. SAP Sustainability Control Tower-Import Greenhouse Gas Emissions from SAP EHS Environment Management 
  7. Addendum to SAP Sustainability Control Tower-Import Greenhouse Gas Emissions from SAP EHSM-EM 
  8. European Sustainability Reporting Standards(ESRS) Journey With SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT) 

Let us dive into our SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT) and see how we can steer the organization`s carbon footprint for each business activity...

Prepare Master Data:

For demonstration purpose, I have chosen the location "Louisiana".

Maintain Emission Factor:

Emission Factors are used in the calculation of Carbon Footprint for different business activities. The default data package is available for use from the US EPA (United States Environmental Protection Agency). If an organization has its own emission factor dataset, it can be used for their carbon footprint calculations by creating a "Custom Dataset".

 

 

 

Manage Business Activities:

A business activity can be any organizational activity used to calculate emissions. For example, I have chosen the business activities listed below. 

For Instance, I have chosen "Business Travel by Company Owned EV".

Now let us assign the emission factor Dataset from the default emission factor reference packages.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Manage GHG Data Collection or Record GHG Data:                                         

  

 

 

 

 

We can use either one app to record GHG Data values in the forms.

For Instance, let us use the app "Manage GHG Data Collections" to create GHG Emission data collection strategy for the location "Louisiana" for the period "May,2024".

For Instance, let us create the data collection strategy for the period "May, 2024".

The GHG Data Forms table shows all the locations that are included in the collection. We can exclude any locations by selecting the location and choosing the option "Not Applicable". We can also undo it by selecting the location in the Not Applicable Tab and choosing the option "Reopen".

For Instance, I have chosen the location "Louisiana".

 

 

Record GHG Data:

Now let us enter the GHG data for the location "Louisiana" using  "Record GHG Data" app.

Once we have updated the field values, set the collection data status as "Completed".

 

Now the entered GHG Data will be reviewed by a designated person to confirm that it is ready for reporting.

Note that the "Reviewer" has to provide the comments.

Now the status will be changed to "reviewed", and the data is published to the "View Emissions Data" app.

 

What If the organization adds a new business activity after reviewing the GHG Data for the defined periods?

SAP has provided an option called "Regenerate". This option is used to regenerate the data collection after changes have been made.

For Instance, I have created a new business activity, i.e., Diesel Consumption for 550 KVA DG Set. This activity falls under Scope-1, Stationary Combustion.

 

Now let us assign the emission factor. I have chosen Quantity Based Calculation.

 

 

Following the successful creation of business activity, we have to come back to "Manage GHG Data Collections" app , then select the relevant collection or even multiple collections  and choose the option "Regenerate".

For Instance I have chosen the collection for periods July 2025 & August 2025.

The status of the collections changes to "In progress" and system generates the data forms for those collections again.

Now let us update the field values and review the data collection using "Record GHG Data" app for the periods July, 2025 & August, 2025.

Now we can update the status to  "Completed" .

 

 

We can now "Review" and update the status to "Reviewed" using "GHG Data Collections" app.

 

 

View Emission Dashboard:

Following the successful recording and review of the Business Activity Data, we can now visualize the overall emissions data for the location using the View Emission Dashboard app.

Emissions Report

 

Emissions Analytics

 

üòäThis concludes the walkthrough of the "SAP Sustainability Control Tower-Climate Action" process. I hope my blog serves as a useful resource for the environmental management team. Stay tuned for more updates on SAP SCT.

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Re: How to use checkboxes as radiobuttons?
entry.content:
Convert them to radio buttons - it's as simple as that.

I would not recommend to implement a radio button function, i.e. only one button of a group can be selected, with check boxes. It is doable technically, but it is going to be very confusing. Just use the right tool for the job.

entry.title: Launchpad Space Missing for One User Despite Same Business Role Assignment
entry.content:
We are running into an issue in our SAP Public Cloud environment regarding Launchpad spaces.

  • Two users are assigned the exact same three business roles.

  • I have verified in the Maintain Business Roles app that one of the role(s) contain one Launchpad Space.

  • This space is customer-managed and hasn‚Äôt been modified in years.

  • For User A, the Launchpad space appears correctly on their SAP Fiori homepage.

  • For User B, the Launchpad space is not showing up at all.

User B is a newly created account that has same the access except for the launchspace. Since both users have identical role assignments, I would expect them to see the same Launchpad space.

Has anyone experienced this discrepancy before, or could share possible causes? Could it be related to space/page assignments, personalization, or a dependency on other role configurations?

Any guidance on where to check next would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: How to set up FOC subcontracting process, without bot...
entry.content:
Hello @Deepika8 

Thanks for sharing the additional information. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, a material ID and system stock availability are required to complete the delivery and post goods issue. Without these, the standard steps cannot be executed.

Here are a few possible approaches to consider:

Generic or non-valued materials: Create a generic material master Returnable Packaging or Calibration Equipment so you have at least a material ID for logistics documents.

Non-stock or service materials: If you only need document flow and not full inventory tracking, non-stock/service material types might meet your needs..

Scope item 3W3 (Advanced Returns Management): Worth reviewing if the process is closer to a customer/vendor return scenario.Executing and Running Customer Returns Management (BKP)-SAP Learning

Custom extension (SAP BTP): If dealing with items without material IDs and stock is a strict requirement, this might suggest a lightweight extension rather than the standard stock-relevant flow.

For the standard RDN/MSDN process in Public Cloud, a material ID and stock in the system are required. If these are not available, you‚Äôll need to model the flow differently using one of the alternatives mentioned above.

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

is your S/4 system a S/4 HANA public cloud system running on HANA 2?

entry.title: Time off Finland - accrual rules and best practices package
entry.content:
Dear community, 

I'm coming to ask if there are customers actually being able to work with Time off in Finland, and having the accrual rules working correctly in the cases of parental leaves.. I've been checking the best practices solution deployed in 1H 2024 but this solution does not seem to fulfill the legal requirements. 1H 2024 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices f... - SAP Community

@NeeleshKamath 

I've been working with a Finnish customer which claims the following legal requirement: Per child, the employee accumulates holidays for a maximum of 160 days of parental leave. This count is made Monday to Saturday. The moment the employee reaches that limit, he stops accumulating holidays in the months he is still absent due to the same child birth. The employee can take the parental leave until the child becomes 2 years old. 

This needs to work together with the Finnish 14 days rule : an employee accumulates holidays for a certain month as long as he has worked at least 14 days in a month. That can be controlled with rule functions "Get Number Of Working Days Or Hours For Period()" from accruable start date to accruable end date. (OK until there)

So what the Best Practices rule (SFCC_ACC_FIN_Holiday_Credit_Accruals)  does is the following: count parental leaves in deduction quantity up to 160 days (monday to saturdays), and from that moment, penalize the employee. In a month, we will get the working days MINUS the days above 160 to see if it is above/below 14 days for the accrual. This solution is never considering which child the absence is about (what if you have multiple children?) and never considering the 2 years period mentioned above (it is checking the 160 limit in the year). 

As a result: this would never work well in reality!

For example imagine an employee has parental leave (reaching 160 days) on the 28th of June 2025, and he is on parental leave until the 12th of july (Saturday).

According to the Best Practices rule, the working days in july are 23. 

The days exceeding 160 days are from the 1st of july until the 12th (in yellow), saturdays included = 11

23 minus 11 = 12 days. 12 days is below 14 days, so the employee should not be eligible to accumulate holidays in that month. 

But in reality the employee should accumulate holidays because: 

Working days = 23

Working Days absent due to parental leave = 9

23 minus 9 = 14 days. Equal or above to the 14 days limit. so he would accrue days for that month. 

The difference is mixing units: working days vs deduction quantity. And deduction quantity days could be even greater than the working days!

So, seriously, has any company been able to work with this successfully?

 

Thank you very much for your time

Laura

entry.title: Re: Handling inventory updates from EWM to S/4HANA Cloud...
entry.content:
Hi Lakshmipathi,

Dear SAP Support,

I would like to reopen this ticket with additional information regarding the handling of inventory differences (physical inventory postings) in the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Üî decentralized EWM integration (scope item 7L1).

Current Situation

  • We are running SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition integrated with a decentralized EWM system.

  • Standard logistics flows work correctly: inbound deliveries, outbound deliveries, pick denial/short-pick quantities are properly reflected back into S/4 via goods issue confirmation.

  • However, physical inventory (PI) differences posted in EWM are not replicated to S/4, which causes stock discrepancies between the two systems.

SAP‚Äôs Previous Suggestion
We received the advice that PI differences could be forwarded via Boomi/CPI using an API.

Why this does not work in our scenario

  • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the only relevant API for posting stock adjustments is API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV.

  • Direct posting of goods movements (e.g. 701/702) via this API works for non-EWM storage locations.

  • But for EWM-managed storage locations, S/4 requires all postings to come through deliveries confirmed by EWM. Direct goods movement postings on those locations are not accepted.

  • This means that forwarding PI differences from EWM to S/4 via Boomi/CPI and calling API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV will not update stock in S/4, as the postings are rejected for EWM-managed storage locations.

Conclusion / Clarification Requested

  • The current 7L1 scope does not support replication of PI differences from decentralized EWM to S/4 Public Cloud.

  • The suggested workaround (Boomi/CPI calling an API) cannot function for EWM-managed storage locations.

Request
Could you please confirm:

  • Is there any supported or planned method in S/4 Public Cloud ‚Üî decentralized EWM integration to replicate PI differences to S/4?

  • If not, can SAP officially confirm that this is out of scope and must be solved with a custom extension, for example a customizing or enhancement in EWM that is triggered by a posting in the Difference Analyzer and automatically creates and sends an adjustment delivery to S/4?

Thank you for your clarification.

entry.title: SAP Completes Acquisition of SmartRecruiters
entry.content:
SAP has announced that it has completed the acquisition of SmartRecruiters, a leading provider of enterprise-grade talent acquisition software. As we shared last month, this acquisition marks a significant milestone in SAP‚Äôs commitment to delivering the capabilities our customers need today while laying the foundation for innovation in the future. 

The SmartRecruiters platform, known for its intuitive user experience and seamless workflows, will now be integrated with the SAP SuccessFactors Human Capital Management (HCM) suite. This addition to the SAP SuccessFactors portfolio will make it easier for enterprises to manage the entire hiring lifecycle, from sourcing to onboarding, with enhanced AI-enabled recruiting capabilities that result in faster time-to-hire, improved candidate experiences, and deeper analytics for workforce planning.  

SmartRecruiters customers will maintain the flexibility to continue using SmartRecruiters solutions with SAP or other HCM solutions. 

What‚Äôs Next? 

Now that the acquisition has closed, we will begin the process of product and company integration. 

We will share more information as it becomes available. For more information, please refer to the official announcement or reach out to your SAP representative. 

Join us virtually at SAP Connect to learn more about the future of SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters.

entry.title: Re: Old Supplier invoice not created with reference to in...
entry.content: The supplier invoice creation from the intercompany billing STO depends on the integration setup being active at the moment the billing document is created. Since the configuration was not yet in place, the supplier invoice was not triggered for CBST billing type. To solve this, I'd recommend you to once the configuration is active, cancel and recreate the CBST billing document. This will trigger the supplier invoice creation.

entry.title: BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST giving return message Profitability segment being derived again
entry.content:
Hello all,

(I am a junior ABAPer working on an incident.)

We have a custom code in which Function module BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST used for posting(CO related).

when ever i try to post the data, i am getting return message from FM in return table like this.

 

here few are Error message and few are Warning, 

1 thing i observed in the return table for multiple line item posting, Profitability segment being derived again is the common message in return table.(all items are not posting).

1)  I want clarify myself, Is the Rederivation is a common thing for all the posting ?

2) If data is correct, still it do re derivation or is there a thing like only derivation?

3) Actually why it do re derivation?

Thanks in advance for your time and effort to explain me this.

Best Regards,

Praveen

entry.title: Re: Timer Integrations in CPI, having null/unix epoch tim...
entry.content: Hi Ramesh, I'm 100% sure that this is not outlook settings, The flow is pretty simple, everyday based on the timer the Integration runs and if it fails in the exception sub process using mail adapter, it sends an email with the attachment. and this mail is coming as striked and says expired.

entry.title: Re: New Pipeline Concept features: new partner id definition, alternative partner, bypass option
entry.content:
@mdhira I was about to update the script but then figured out that you could run your P2P scenario on Edge Integration Cell already today, you just have to define a header partnerID in your scenario-specific inbound flow, this header is passed to the generic outbound flow, and when set your script won't fail. Usually this header holds the configuration scenario name and is used to call the Partner Directory, in your case you don't need it to call the Partner Directory but to ensure that the script won't fail, so you can choose any value.

Some background:

I intended to change this part assuming that when running the script on Edge Integration Cell, the service will be null, and if null I would then skip all the rest of the code. However, I just learned that although the Partner Directory is not supported yet on Edge, the Partner Directory tables already exist on Edge and hence this script will never throw an exception.

def service = ITApiFactory.getApi(PartnerDirectoryService.class, null);
if (service == null){
throw new IllegalStateException("Partner Directory Service not found");
}

So, the reason why the script fails is this part where we throw an error if partnerID is not set which is the case for P2P scenarios where you directly store the message in the last JMS queue PIPQ04 bypassing the main pipeline.

// get pid
def headers = message.getHeaders();
def Pid = headers.get("partnerID");
if (Pid == null){
throw new IllegalStateException("Partner ID not found in sent message");
}

So, to run P2P scenario without involving the main pipeline, you need to define the following headers in the scenario-specific inbound flow:

  • SAP_OutboundProcessingEndpoint with value ProcessDirect end point of your scenario-specific outbound flow
  • partnerID with any value
  • optionally: maxJMSRetries to reduce the number of attempts to restart failed messages

Long term we can make the script more robust so that it also works without the partnerID but for the time being you are not blocked. We also think about to support more use cases by maintaining more parameters in the scenario-specific inbound flows so that the Partner Directory doesn't need to be called and hence more scenarios can be run on Edge as long as the Partner Directory is not supported on Edge.

Alex

entry.title: Re: SAP Central Finance - Configuration Consistency Check
entry.content: Good document;   Thanks for sharing

entry.title: Re: Non Manager/subordinate as active participant in SuccessFactors Compensation process
entry.content:
@xavierlegarrec - Thanks for mentioning the API. 

I tested this one for a specific plan using postman

/rest/rewards/compensation/v1/employeeCompensations?$expand=salary&$filter=compPlanId eq 35224&$top=25&$skip=0&templateId=501

gives lot of data in response but here are the challenges:

1. No option to filter worksheets based on route map status. 

2. No option to filter based on specific user.

Yes, it could replace the table report that i had used but without route map filter , it won't help much. I would still advise and use table report as it is very easy and quick to setup. Only in case we would need to send data to some analytical tools or to the payroll system after completion, may be that's the requirement when i would advise and explore it to be used.

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI Checkbox events are not getting received imme...
entry.content: As far as I know, it is normal and expected behavior unless a user command is associated with the checkbox.

entry.title: How to download and from where SAP BO 3.1 Installers for server and client to see .REP files
entry.content:
Hello everyone..!! I hope yo are very well 

We need to open .REP reports , I know that these reports cab be open in SAP BO 3.1 ( Im not sure which SP) I read that is possible to convert them using Report Conversion Tool , I used this tool in SAP Bo 4.2 SP6 but it shows  error  I considerated to install BO 3.1 but I dont have the full installer  in SAP Support portal i can only see Update but no full installer. What can be done to see these reports?

Thanks a lot for the help

Best Regards
